meanings.def: a problem or temporary failure when you are on the way to achieving something
examples: There were good reasons for the team's first-round stumble against Los Angeles.

meanings.def: an act of falling or almost falling, especially because you hit your foot against something
examples: After a slight stumble backwards, he regained his balance.

meanings.def: a mistake that causes you to stop when you are reading, speaking or playing music
to hit your foot against something while you are walking or running and almost fall
examples: stumble over/on something I stumbled over a rock.
She stumbled a little on the uneven path.
(figurative) The economy stumbled badly at the end of 2000.

meanings.def: to walk or move in an unsteady way
examples: Max stumbled out of bed sleepily.
We were stumbling around in the dark looking for a candle.
The old man stumbled out into the night.
He stumbled drunkenly across the road.
Half asleep, she stumbled into the bathroom.
The train stopped, and several passengers stumbled to their feet.

meanings.def: to make a mistake or mistakes and stop while you are speaking, reading to somebody or playing music
examples: In her nervousness she stumbled over her words.
I stumbled through the piano piece with difficulty.
